focus_area: Key Statistical Patterns in Civic Character

curated_evidence.focus_area: Key Statistical Patterns in Civic Character
statistical_targets: Bimodal distribution of Civic Character Index (virtue-dominant vs. vice-dominant examples)
Rhetorical differences between populist and institutional speaking styles (Cohen's d = 3.53)
Co-occurrence of related dimensions (e.g., Dignity/Justice, Tribalism/Resentment)
Prominence of Justice-Resentment and Identity-Dignity axes
curated_evidence.curation_instructions: In a single pass, curate a balanced set of quotes that exemplify the primary statistical findings. Prioritize quotes that: (1) Represent the highest and lowest scores on the Civic Character Index to illustrate the bimodal distribution. (2) Directly contrast the rhetorical styles of `populist` and `institutional` speakers. (3) Show clear co-expression of correlated virtues (Dignity, Justice) and vices (Tribalism, Resentment). (4) Provide powerful examples for the high-prominence Justice-Resentment and Identity-Dignity axes.
